meanings.definition: To convert (a fat or oil) into soap by reaction with an alkali.
meanings.sent1: I learned in science class that we can saponify oils to make soap.
meanings.sent2: The soap-making process involves saponifying fats with lye.
meanings.sent3: When the chef accidentally added too much lye, the dish saponified into a soapy mess!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity saponified the mundane ingredients into a masterpiece dish.
meanings.sent5: The magical potion saponified the dirty water into sparkling bubbles.

meanings.sent1: The oils will saponify when mixed with the alkaline solution.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, we observed the fats saponify into soap.
meanings.sent3: The potion saponified in the cauldron, creating a surprising reaction.
meanings.sent4: As time passed, the ingredients seemed to saponify on their own, forming a unique blend.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious liquid began to saponify, bubbling and changing color before our eyes.
